etymology.description: Depicts two blocks of metal. Originally disconnected, the connecting line was added in later scripts.
etymology.interpretation: The two blocks evoke the image of separate pieces of metal, which can signify both physical objects and the idea of connection when linked.

examples.chinese: 他给了我一个呂(他給了我一個呂)，我很高兴(我很高興)。
examples.pinyin: tā gěi le wǒ yī gè lǚ, wǒ hěn gāoxìng.
examples.english: He gave me a lǚ, and I was very happy.

examples.chinese: 在音乐中，呂(在音樂中，呂)的音符很美(的音符很美)。
examples.pinyin: zài yīnyuè zhōng, lǚ de yīnfú hěn měi.
examples.english: In music, the notes of lǚ are beautiful.
